issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
I upgraded the SC from 4.3.1 to the latest 4.4.0.  After the upgrade, the SC fails to start because the eucalyptus-cloud package is missing.  I see these errors when trying to restart the service.
{code}

Found empty or unset manager(null).  Legal values are: overlay,das,ceph-rbd

fields.summary: eucalyptus-cloud-upgrade.service tries to run euca-upgrade when it isn't there

comments.body: Changing status to CRITICAL because there is a workaround.  I was able to get the SC working again by installing eucalyptus-cloud after the upgrade.
This happens because euca-upgrade is only installed with the CLC package, eucalyptus-cloud.
Fixed in eucalyptus-rpmspec commit {{497b5cc}}, which ensures that eucalyptus-cloud-upgrade.service cannot be installed without the euca-upgrade script.

i attempted this upgrade again with a separate storage controller and I was able to start eucalyptus-cloud without having to reinstall the package.  Verified.
{code}
[root@a-36 ~]# rpm -qi eucalyptus
Name        : eucalyptus
Version     : 4.4.0
Release     : 0.25804.159.20170214git1b3dd86.el7
Architecture: x86_64
Install Date: Wed 15 Feb 2017 04:26:18 PM PST
Group       : Unspecified
Size        : 248090
{code}
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
